items.definition_en: A perennial plant lives for more than two years.
items.example_en: The gardener prefers using perennial plants for a low-maintenance garden.

items.definition_en: A shrub is a woody plant that is smaller than a tree.
items.example_en: She trimmed the shrub to keep it looking neat.

items.definition_en: A creeper is a plant that grows along the ground or climbs surfaces.
items.example_en: A beautiful creeper covers one side of the garden fence.

items.definition_en: An evergreen is a plant that keeps its leaves all year round.
items.example_en: The evergreen near the gate stays green through the winter.

items.definition_en: A succulent is a plant with thick leaves that store water.
items.example_en: She collects succulents for her windowsill garden.

items.definition_en: A sapling is a young tree.
items.example_en: The class planted a sapling as part of their science project.

items.definition_en: A climber is a plant that grows upward by attaching itself to a structure.
items.example_en: The rose climber has reached the top of the trellis.

items.definition_en: A bulb is a round underground part of some plants from which new plants grow.
items.example_en: In autumn, she planted tulip bulbs in the flowerbeds.

items.definition_en: Ornamental grass is grown in gardens mainly for decoration.
items.example_en: They added ornamental grass to give the border more texture.

items.definition_en: A ground cover is a plant that grows over soil to help prevent weeds.
items.example_en: Ground cover like ivy helps keep the soil from drying out.

items.definition_en: A herbaceous plant has soft, green stems and no woody parts.
items.example_en: Many gardeners prefer herbaceous plants for colorful flowerbeds.

items.definition_en: A deciduous tree sheds its leaves in autumn.
items.example_en: The deciduous trees turn beautiful colors in the fall.

items.definition_en: A flowering shrub is a bush that produces flowers.
items.example_en: The flowering shrubs create a vibrant display in spring.

items.definition_en: A seedling is a young plant grown from a seed.
items.example_en: Each seedling needs sunlight to grow strong.

items.definition_en: A rhizome is a thick underground stem from which new shoots grow.
items.example_en: Bamboo spreads quickly because of its rhizomes.

items.definition_en: A fern is a plant with feathery leaves and no flowers.
items.example_en: Ferns thrive in the shady parts of the garden.

items.definition_en: A conifer is a tree that usually has cones and needle-like leaves.
items.example_en: The tall conifers provide privacy along the fence.

items.definition_en: A topiary is a plant shaped into decorative forms by cutting and trimming.
items.example_en: The impressive topiary in the front yard looks like an elephant.

items.definition_en: A wildflower is a flower that grows naturally without being planted by people.
items.example_en: In summer, the meadow is covered in wildflowers.

items.definition_en: A specimen plant is grown mainly to be noticed for its unique features.
items.example_en: They chose a palm as the specimen plant for the center of the lawn.
